snippet: The company maintained its forecast for 7 percent growth in aluminum demand this year, even though aluminum prices fell about 8 percent in the second quarter.
abstract: Alcoa reports second-quarter loss of $119 million, or 11 cents a share, compared with loss of $2 million in year-ago quarter; revenue falls 2 percent to $5.85 billion; maintains its forecast for 7 percent growth in aluminum demand for 2013.
lead_paragraph: The company maintained its forecast for 7 percent growth in aluminum demand this year, even though aluminum prices fell about 8 percent in the second quarter.

headline.main: Alcoa Posts $119 Million Loss, but Still Sees Higher Demand
headline.print_headline: Alcoa Posts $119 Million Loss, but Still Sees Higher Demand
